text: The argument from inconsistent revelations is an argument that aims to show that one cannot choose one religion over another since their revelations are inconsistent with each other and that any two religions cannot be true. == Appearances == The argument appears, among other places, in Voltaire's Candide and Philosophical Dictionary. It is also manifested in Denis Diderot's statement that, whatever proofs are offered for the existence of God in Christianity or any other religion, "an Imam can reason the same way". == See also == * Argument from nonbelief * Argumentum ad populum * Denis Diderot * Religious exclusivism * Religious pluralism * Voltaire == References == Inconsistent revelations, argument from
title: Argument from inconsistent revelations
